III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(iv)Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or
discriminatory language including negative references to a youth’s
background or appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats,
ridicule, or humiliation are strictly prohibited.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Supervisor 1 allegedly "slung" a youth on the floor causing a
scratch under his right eye and injuries.
Investigation There is no video footage of the incident.
I spoke to Complainant 1 on 10/4/23 via telephone. Complainant 1
did not provide any new information.
I spoke to Administrator 1 on 10/4/23. Administrator 1 reported
that Youth A’s last restraint was on 9/9/23. Administrator 1
reported that Supervisor 1 was involved in the restraint as the
supervisor on 9/9/23. Administrator 1 reported that Youth A does
cross his arms and squeeze them as self-harming behavior and
they have started, since these allegations, to keep a body chart for
him.
I spoke to Foster Care Worker 1 on 10/4/23 and she reported that
she did not see any marks or bruises on Youth A when she visited
him on 9/26/23. Foster Care Worker 1 also reported that Youth A
will squeeze his arms to inflict harm to himself. Foster Care
Worker 1 reported that Youth A has been involved in many
incidents since he has been at placement.
Interviews were conducted face to face at the facility on
10/9/23 with DHHS Worker 1:
Youth A:
Youth A refused to talk to this consultant. No injuries were
observed by this consultant.
Supervisor 1:
Supervisor 1 reported that he has not restrained Youth A nor
escorted him at any time throughout Youth A’s placement.
Supervisor 1 reported he oversaw a restraint on 9/9/23 being
conducted by Staff 2 and Staff 3. Supervisor 1 reported all the
other youth were removed from the area and the staff on duty
restrained Youth A by holding his arms and Youth A then
deescalated within 2-3 minutes. Supervisor 1 reported Youth A did
have “flailing arms” during the restraint and was attempting to get
out of it. Supervisor 1 reported the restraint went well. Supervisor
1 reported he left the cottage after Youth A was deescalated.
Supervisor 1 reported Youth A did not complain to him about
receiving any injuries or staff hurting him in any way. Supervisor 1
2

reported Youth A will throw himself down on the floor and hug
himself tightly when he doesn’t get his way.
Staff 1:
Staff 1 was interviewed due to Youth A reporting to the on call
DHHS Worker that Staff 1 was there at the time Supervisor 1
“slung” him to the floor. Staff 1 reported that he has never been
involved in a restraint with Youth A, or with anyone at the agency
to date, and that he has never seen Supervisor 1 restrain Youth A,
or push him, or throw him. Staff 1 reported that Youth A will act
out when he hears the word “no.” Staff 1 reported Youth A will
throw himself up against the wall, ball up his fist, throw himself
onto the floor, and try to break something to hurt himself. Staff 1
reported he has never seen anyone restrain Youth A as of yet.
Staff 1 reported he has been working for the agency about a
month.
I reviewed the following documents:
The agency schedule showed Supervisor 1 and Staff 1 have not
worked at the same time.
The incident report dated 9/9/23 is consistent with Supervisor 1’s
account. Staff 2 and Staff 3 performed the restraint and
Supervisor 1 was notified of the restraint. The incident reported
there were no injuries.
The Body Chart was reviewed for the 9/9/23 restraint, completed
by Nurse 1, and Youth A had bruising on his upper bicep area.
Chart reported, “…bruising but claims it is not from anything but
playing on the playground…”
Supervisor 1’s personnel file: All clearances were completed
according to Child Caring Institution Rules. All trainings were up to
date and there was not disciplinary action in his file.
DHHS Worker 1 did not have any findings in his report.
Analysis There is no evidence to validate the allegations. Supervisor 1 was
not involved in a restraint with Youth A. Youth A reported that Staff
1 was involved with the restraint with Supervisor 1 yet neither
have restrained or worked together per the schedule. The last
incident report involving a restraint on 9/9/23 with no new ones to
this present day. Youth A refused to talk; therefore, there was no
other information to gather.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
